score.explanation: Your Wi-Fi network is performing well with moderate congestion. However, random dropouts may still occur.
score.trend_summary: Since last scan: download improved, upload improved, ping worsened, networks stayed the same.

latest_report.diagnosis: The network showcases good performance metrics but may experience interference due to congestion on certain channels, leading to random dropouts.

performance.interpretation: Your download speed is excellent for streaming and gaming, while the upload speed is adequate for standard tasks. The ping is generally good but could be optimized further.

problems: Potential placement issues due to router location.
fixes: Change the 2.4GHz channel to 1 or 6 to reduce congestion.
Set the 5GHz channel to 149 or 161, as 36 is crowded.
Enable Band Steering if supported to optimize device distribution.
Consider relocating the router for better signal coverage.
Limit the number of devices connected simultaneously to reduce load.
